etymology.description: 糸(糸) (mì, "silk thread") + 糸(糸) (mì, "silk thread") = intertwining threads -> silk
etymology.interpretation: The character 丝(絲) represents the intertwining of silk threads, effectively symbolizing the core concept of silk through repetition of the 糸(糸) component, which originally depicts silk.
etymology.simplification: 丝(絲) simplifies the repeated 糸(糸) into a single 纟(纟) stroke for efficiency while maintaining the association with silk.

examples.chinese: 她穿着用纟制成的衣服(她穿著用絲製成的衣服)。
examples.pinyin: Tā chuānzhuó yòng sī zhìchéng de yīfú.
examples.english: She is wearing clothes made of silk.

examples.chinese: 这块纟图案的披肩(這塊絲圖案的披肩)，让人联想到古代的华服(讓人聯想到古代的華服)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè kuài sī tú'àn de pījiān, ràng rén liánxiǎng dào gǔdài de huáfú.
examples.english: This shawl with a silk pattern reminds people of the elegant attire of ancient times.

examples.chinese: 博物馆里展出了唐朝时用纟织造的绸缎(博物館裡展出了唐朝時用絲織造的綢緞)。
examples.pinyin: Bówùguǎn lǐ zhǎnchūle Tángcháo shí yòng sī zhīzào de chóuduàn.
examples.english: The museum displayed silk brocade that was woven during the Tang Dynasty.
